Description: Fragment of a plain weave, undyed linen textile onto which two fragments of a tapestry band have been sewn; a T shape remains, the top of the T is13.5x4.5cm and the stem is damaged; the main band has a red background and decoration (damaged) similar to the female human figures of 20413; this might be part of the decoration of the same child's tunic, maybe a sleeve or bottom part of the tunic; plain weave: warp-undyed linen (S/20), weft-undyed linen (S/16); one selvedge is hemmed and sewn under the tapestry, the others are cut and ragged; tapestry on grouped threads: warp-undyed linen (S spun Z ply/12), weft-undyed linen (S), yellow, green, red and dark blue wool (S/red is 52); two selvedges remain and are reinforced with grouped threads, other edges are hemmed and sewn under; sewing threads in undyed linen (S spun Z ply) in running stitches and oversewing
Acquisition name: Purchased from: Rev Greville John Chester
